location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 61: Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire, to His Excellency Lieutenant-Colonel Justin Sheil, Her Majesty's Minister Plenipotentiary and Envoy Extraordinary at the Court of Persia, Tehran

mods.abstract: This letter provides details of attempts made by officials acting under His Royal Highness Bahram Mirza [Prince Governor of Fars] to persuade Bakir Khan, Chief of Tungistoon [TangestƒÅn], to evacuate Chacoota and restore it to Sheik Nasir, Governor of Bushire. In addition, the letter includes the following enclosures:Translated substance of a report from the Agent at Shiraz of occurrences in that quarter from 26 December 1849 to 3 January 1850.Translated substance of a report from the Agent at Shiraz of occurrences in that quarter from 3 to 26 January 1850.
